thread.title: Jena Malone to play Barbra Gordon in ‘Batman v Superman’?
thread.title_full: Jena Malone to play Barbra Gordon in ‘Batman v Superman’? | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Jena Malone to play Barbra Gordon in ‘Batman v Superman’?
text:
Other Articles Hulk Hogan mourns wrestler pal Roddy Piper's death Daniel Radcliffe to play FBI agent in 'Imperium' We still call Caitlyn Jenner 'Bruce': Khloe Kardashian “Hunger Games” actress Jena Malone will reportedly play Barbra Gordon, who has two alter egos Batgirl and Oracle, in the upcoming superhero film “Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice”.
The 30-year-old actress was already confirmed to be a part of the much-anticipated movies but her role was undisclosed.
Barbara is the current Batgirl who works alongside Batman and the first Robin in the comics, reported Aceshowbiz.
She is also a daughter of Commissioner James Gordon, who has been rumored to be dead in the upcoming movie.
Barbara adapted alter ego Oracle and helped the Caped Crusader and other heroes using a massive world-wide communications and espionage network, after she was paralysed by the Joker in Alan Moore’s “The Killing Joke” graphic novel.
Previously, Malone was rumored to play a female version of Robin based on the Carrie Kelley character from Frank Miller’s “The Dark Knight Returns”.
It was her recently-dyed red hair which sparked the speculation that she would play Kelley.
When the Comic-Con trailer surfaced, fans immediately noticed that it was not Malone, who played Robin. It can be seen from Robin’s suit in the trailer, which resembles man’s body size. So, Robin is possibly a young man played by director Zack Snyder’s son Eli Snyder.
Even if the rumour is true, it is still unclear whether Malone will play Batgirl or Oracle in the upcoming movie.
“Batman v Superman” centres on the conflict between the two titular superheroes, Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill). It will mark the launching of DC Cinematic Universe in which other superheroes such as Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) and Aquaman (Jason Momoa) join the Caped Crusader and the Man of Steel.
Directed by Zack, the movie will arrive in US theatres on March 25, 2016.
First Published on August 01, 2015 10:03 am
